intro: Lavoisiera crassifolia f. grandifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved lavoisiera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its large, broad leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, a typical feature of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and delicate flowers.
